intro: Hagsatera brachycolumna, commonly known as the short-columned hagsatera, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. The plant features narrow, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically tubular and come in shades of red, pink, or purple. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a container plant.
